results.title: Drying
results.creator_credit: Don Kelly and Gerard Holdsworth Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Preservign and Drying of Plant Material”.
One of three films dealing with different aspects of preserving and drying of plant material, showing the techniques and everyday domestic equipment needed to achieve satisfactory results. This film deals with preservation by drying.

results.title: Dry pastures and flood plains
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Jack Rogers
results.brief_description: As well as the difficulties encountered in selling Australia’s surplus of dairy products over our domestic needs, dairy farmers face extremes of climate conditions - lack of adequate regular rainfall, flooding, poor soil, etc. Examines ways of overcoming these difficulties via research into pasture improvement and its application and the introduction of new and improved farming machinery and equipment.

results.title: Drunken Master
results.creator_credit: Zhang Quan, Seasonal Film Corporation and Yuen Woo-Ping
results.brief_description: This 1978 Hong Kong film, one of the earliest to star Jackie Chan, highlights the relationship between a student and his martial arts master.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Zhang Quan, Seasonal Film Corporation and Yuen Woo-Ping
results.description: This 1978 Hong Kong film, one of the earliest to star Jackie Chan, highlights the relationship between a student and his martial arts master. Wong Fei Hung, played by Chan, is a 19th Century folk hero in Chinese culture and cinema, a master of kung fu who fights the injustice of British colonialism (this character would later be portrayed by Jet Li in ‘Once upon a time in China’). Drunken Master finds Wong in his early years as a troublesome fighter who is sent to his uncle, the hard-drinking title character, for instruction in discipline and martial arts. After enduring torturous training, Wong runs away only to encounter some local villains. Being badly beaten, he returns to his uncle who finally trains him in “drunken style” kung fu. Cast includes: Jackie Chan, Simon Yuen and Lam Yin.
description_for_label: This 1978 Hong Kong film, one of the earliest to star Jackie Chan, highlights the relationship between a student and his martial arts master. Wong Fei Hung, played by Chan, is a 19th Century folk hero in Chinese culture and cinema, a master of kung fu who fights the injustice of British colonialism (this character would later be portrayed by Jet Li in ‘Once upon a time in China’). Drunken Master finds Wong in his early years as a troublesome fighter who is sent to his uncle, the hard-drinking title character, for instruction in discipline and martial arts. After enduring torturous training, Wong runs away only to encounter some local villains. Being badly beaten, he returns to his uncle who finally trains him in “drunken style” kung fu. Cast includes: Jackie Chan, Simon Yuen and Lam Yin.

results.title: Drunken boat = Bateau ivre
results.creator_credit: Henri Beauvais, Franfilmdis and Alfred Chaumel
results.brief_description: After the poems of J. Arthur Rimbaud and the symphony “Bateau Ivre” by Robert Bergmann. Prelude for two voices Simon Gantillon and the voice of Rimbaud is Jean-Luis Barrault. In French with no English subtitles.

results.brief_description: Mastering the techniques of playing the drums. Introducing the drums, music for drums, techniques, foot co-ordination and co-ordination of the drum kit are shown.

results.title: Drums for a holiday
results.creator_credit: Peter Stiles, Anglo-Scottish Pictures and A R Taylor
results.brief_description: This film looks at the Gold Coast (now Ghana), its history, industries and export trade in cotton and cocoa, and social and political life. Half of the world’s cocoa comes from this region, and the harvesting, fermenting, drying, grading according to quality, and selling and shipping of the beans is illustrated. The film records a ceremonial parade to the local Durbar attended by the King of Ashanti, village Chiefs, and British representatives. Commentary by Leo Genn; photography by Stanley Gooze and edited by John Ferris

results.title: Drugs: a primary film
results.brief_description: Presents vignettes of situations familiar to children to explore the correct use of drugs by the doctor and at home. Reveals the danger of drug misuse and emphasises the positive attitudes needed for a rich and healthy life. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Drugs, use or abuse
results.brief_description: Beginning with various types of beneficial drugs, the film moves to excessive use, stimulants and depressants, damaging chemicals in drugs, psychological dependence and forms of harmful drugs. Presents basic information about drugs and moves the viewer towards their own conclusion.

results.title: Drugs Are Not the Problem
results.brief_description: In themselves drugs are not a problem but their abuse is. The film shows young people using various drugs and the penultimate consequence of addiction. There is a clear, diagrammatic representation of how the human mind and nervous system work and how drugs affect them. Above all, the film repeatedly points out that the human mind is capable of the greatest powers.
